intro: Burckella brachypoda, commonly known as the short-stemmed burrweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and has a low, sprawling growth habit. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed schizocarp that splits into two one-seeded parts when mature. Burckella brachypoda is often found in wetland environments and is adapted to thrive in areas with high humidity.
